awd_titl_txt: Paleoclimate and Evolution: A Conference on Human Origins   to be held Fall, 1992, at Airlie, Virginia
awd_abstract_narration: This award will help to support a conference on Paleoclimate and                Evolution.  The conference will bring together a large number of                scholars with paleontological, meteorological and anthropological               expertise in order to better understand the interactions between                paleoclimates in the Miocene, Pliocene and Pleistocene and major                developments in primate, specifically hominine, evolution.                      Particular attention will be given to attempts to inter-relate                  the newer dates for paleoclimatic events with periods of                        evolutionary significance in human ancestry.  It is hoped that it               will be possible to resolve, or at least crystallize, conflicting               hypotheses about the phylogenetic status of earlier hominines.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
